page.title: 06NAIRN HARBOUR
page.content: To the west of the{River Nairn's} entrance to the Moray Firth is the harbour basin.Once it was used only for the protecion of{Nairn's Fishing {Boats}but today out of the seventy boats moored there only two are employed in fishing.One boat fishes according to the season for prawns, lobster and crabs.The other boat is used to retrieve salmon from the stake nets stationed on the shore.This summer season two boats intend taking parties out fishing.Most of the remaining boats in the harbour are used for for pleasure and are members of{Nairn sailing club
